opportunities.description: Use sewing skills to mend and repair clothing for people experiencing homelessness.

opportunities.description: Bake desserts and treats for families experiencing homelessness at the Family Service Center.

opportunities.title: Court-Ordered Volunteer Opportunities
opportunities.description: Complete court-ordered volunteer hours at the Distribution Center.

opportunities.title: Student Internship Opportunities
opportunities.description: Intern with Catholic Charities to gain hands-on experience in social services.

opportunities.title: Family and Youth Volunteer Opportunities
opportunities.description: Volunteer opportunities for families and youth groups (age 14+ with adult supervision).

policies: Volunteers must be 18 years or older to volunteer independently
Volunteers aged 14-17 can participate with adult supervision and minor waiver
Groups of 3-15 people can generally be accommodated
Large groups of 20-100+ can be accommodated by special arrangement with advance notice
Closed-toe shoes required for all volunteers
Long pants required for kitchen work
No heavy perfumes or colognes recommended
Advance cancellation required if unable to attend scheduled volunteer shift
All volunteers receive task description, training, and supervision
More than 4,000 volunteers donate time annually
Volunteers provided over 40,000+ service hours last year

online.notes: Donations support emergency shelters, affordable housing, meals, children and family services, and aging/disability programs

accepted_items.details: Winter jackets/coats (men's adult sizes), waterproof mittens and gloves (adult sizes), winter boots (all ages/sizes/genders), athletic shoes (men's sizes 9-13), slip-on shoes (Croc style), underwear (all sizes, male and female), belts (one-size and stretch), men's jeans/pants (34in to 44in), sweatshirts and sweatpants (M-4XL), crew socks (cotton and thermal), long sleeve t-shirts (L-4XL), thermal underwear sets (M-4XL), pajama sets

Lotion (full and travel sizes), toothpaste (full and travel sizes), chapstick/lip balm, razors, coily textured hair products (braiding kits, deep conditioner, styling products), deodorant (gender neutral), body spray and perfume, body wash and bar soap (full and travel sizes), foot powder, shampoo and conditioner (full and travel sizes), tampons
Towels (bath, hand, and washcloths), air beds with pump (twin, full, queen), 'Bed in a Bag'/bed sets (twin, full, queen), sheet sets (twin, full, queen), blankets or comforters (twin, full, queen)
Cooking pots with lid (2qt-4qt), frying pans (8in-12in), starter pot and pan cooking sets, crock pots/slow cookers, air fryers
Non-perishable food items for distribution to programs

Hand and foot warmers, sketch/drawing pads, meditation/mandala coloring books, colored pencils/marker sets, word search/sudoku books, alarm clocks, shower shoes/flip flops, backpacks (adult size), bike locks, fidgets or sensory toys, blank journals, monthly planners

not_accepted: Used items (all donations must be new and unwrapped)
policies: All items must be new and unused
Large donations or group collections should call ahead to arrange drop-off
Do not leave donations outside the doors
Donations must be collected and weighed by staff for food safety and inventory tracking

vehicle.process_description: Donate cars, trucks, trailers, boats, RVs, motorcycles, and other motorized vehicles. Free pickup available. Running or not running vehicles accepted. Tax deductible donation receipt provided.

other_methods.description: Leave a legacy through wills, trusts, beneficiary designations, charitable gift annuities, life insurance, retirement assets, stocks, bonds, and real estate.
Simple, flexible, tax-efficient way to make charitable contributions to areas matching your interests such as housing stability or advocacy.
Organize a fundraising event with family, friends, and coworkers to support Catholic Charities Twin Cities.

organization.mission: Our mission is to serve those most in need. We are a leader at solving poverty, creating opportunity, and advocating for justice in the community.

services.name: Adult Emergency Shelters
services.description: Overnight emergency shelter providing safety, hot meals, showers, lockers, and pathways to stability for adults experiencing homelessness.

services.name: Affordable Housing Solutions
services.description: Permanent supportive housing for individuals, veterans, and people with complex medical conditions including single-room occupancy units.

services.name: Opportunity Centers
services.description: Daytime resources connecting people with medical and mental health care, meals, showers, internet access, laundry, and employment counseling.

services.name: Children and Family Services
services.description: Comprehensive support including early parenting education, preventive services, family shelter, childcare, and day treatment programs.

services.name: Aging and Disability Services
services.description: Person-centered support empowering vulnerable elders and individuals with disabilities to live safely and independently through intensive case management.

services.name: Food Services
services.description: More than one million meals served annually through breakfast, lunch, dinner, and family-style meal programs at various locations.

services.name: Medical Respite
services.description: Short-term recuperative care for people experiencing homelessness who need additional recovery time after hospital release.

services.name: Housing First Program
services.description: Supportive services helping people experiencing homelessness secure and maintain housing in apartments throughout the community.

organization.service_area: Twin Cities metro area (Minneapolis and St. Paul), Minnesota

locations.name: Catholic Charities Administrative Center (The Frey Center)
The Mary F. Frey Opportunity Center
Higher Ground Saint Paul (Dorothy Day Place campus)
Richard M. Schulze Family Foundation Saint Paul Opportunity Center
locations.address: Dorothy Day Place campus, Saint Paul, MN

about.history: For more than 150 years, Catholic Charities has been an integral part of the Twin Cities community, directly serving the most vulnerable neighbors and adapting to meet evolving community needs.

upcoming_events.name: Spirit of the Season
upcoming_events.description: Holiday fundraising event featuring dining, music, and mission stories at The Depot Minneapolis.

upcoming_events.name: Giving Tree at Mall of America
upcoming_events.description: Community event to shop for gifts for people in need, participate in volunteer activities, and learn about Catholic Charities.

upcoming_events.name: Zoomin' with Catholic Charities
upcoming_events.description: Virtual event discussing housing and mental health with CEO Jamie Verbrugge and Catholic Charities staff.
